content.description: Pulls through the same roof system as Psycho Lizards.
content.location: South Face (The Alley).  First sport route in the Alley.

content.description: Plenty of pockets provide good holds for hands and feet if you can get your body in the right position.  Follow the line of bolts diagonally up the rock towards the right.  I would go ahead and clip the first bolt before you start and clip in because the beginning is one of the toughest parts of the climb, and you will find yourself rolling down the hill if you fall.
content.protection: 6 or 7 draws are good. Chains for anchors.
content.location: To the left of Look Ma, No Head!.

content.description: The very first route.  It goes right up the end of the rock under an overhanging nose.  Shares the second pitch with Russian One-Step.
content.protection: Bring a range of sizes of trad gear plus a few draws.  Only has 2 bolts on the first pitch going to the anchors, other than that this route is trad all the way.
content.location: Right where the trail splits to go the either the North Face or the South Face.

content.description: This route goes past a couple of bulges past a tree and up a flaring crack to the top.
content.protection: There are a couple bolts below the tree and chains at the top.
content.location: This route is on Moon Rock, just across the alley from Welcome to the Jungle.

content.description: A slightly overhanging crack route.  This route is incredibly fun, one of the more fun routes that I have climbed at DRT.  Shares anchor chains with Gargoyle.
content.location: immediately left of Gargoyle.

content.description: Straight forward climb going up the same face as Wet Willie.  Filled with small pockets that do not provide too many good holds.  This is a tricky climb but is pretty fun.
content.location: Immediately left of Wet Willie.

content.description: P1: Climb face to a large lie-back and belay from one bolt/gear on ledge.P2: Move left at big crack and continue straight to top. This pitch is a bit dirty and basically overlaps with Lucy.
content.location: Main Fin (North Face) left of Green Eggs and Welcome to the Jungle.

content.description: P1 -- Obvious traverse from up in the alley towards the arete to ledge to anchors (possibly sketch). Belay from here.    P2 -- pull bulge and finish up the route to the top with easy climbing.
content.protection: Standard rack. Tricams are awesome. If it makes you feel better, you can step and clip one of the bolts from Zombie Stomp.
content.location: Starts in the alley. Finishes on top of where Lucy ends up. Rap with double ropes to the ground, or rap to ledge on Lucy with single then pull rope and rap again to ground.

content.description: Climb up to a small ledge just below the first bolt to clip.  A little run out here but its easy climbing.  Follow the huge flake up the wall for 6 bolts to the anchors.  Very fun route with a cool setting going up the flake with great views from the anchors.
content.location: To the left of Flash Gordon on the huge flake.  If you miss the flake you shouldn't be climbing.

content.description:
Starts at the base of the large tree.   

  Positive holds up to first bolt, but if you feel hesitant, stick-clipping wouldn't hurt on this one.
content.protection:
5 bolts.  #1 tricam fits nicely in the runout between the 2nd and 3rd bolt.   

  There was a tree to rap off, but it's real dead.  There is now a rat's nest with a locking biner that Palm Tree and Bounty Hunter end at.  Rap off and/or back-up with own gear.
content.location: The Alley (South face).  Immediately left of Bounty Hunter.  2nd sport route you will come to walking up hill - Zombie Stomp (11c) is the first.

content.description: Climb up the nose of Moon Rock, clip 2 old pins and belay from chains at top.
content.protection: 2 old pins.  Gear is sparse.  .1-1" BD cams, nothing larger.
content.location: On the Southside of Moon Rock, which is the rock formation adjacent to the main fin.  Appx 100' before walking into the main fin, the trail cuts right and will take you to the backside of Moon Rock.  Once on the backside (southside), hike up until vegetation clears and begin climbing toward the prow proper.

content.description: A decent face route to the left of trick or treat.  This on is a little sketch as the bolts are a little more run out that usual for DRT.  Trick moves make this a must for anyone that wants a challenging 10b/c.
content.location: Up the hill about 15 feet from Trick or Treat.  There is a large tree that runs up about 2 feet from the wall.

content.description: 150' feet of fun climbing. First pitch is more enjoyable than the second. If you top out, rappel down to the ledge, then pull the rope, and rap of the ledge. Or trail a second rope, and do it all in one rap.
content.protection: 10-12 draws... 15 feet between the bolts is the norm. First pitch ends on a ledge with open cold shuts
content.location: Located directly after the trail splits to go to either North Face or the Alley.  Go to the North Face, and walk around the nose, and you will see a string of draws going up a darker section of rock.  This is Lucy in the Sky.  It is the tallest section of the rock as well.

content.description: Starts on a small slabby face to a small overhang.  Once you are around the overhang, it is a relatively easy face that is a tad run out.  Easier to continue left and get the last couple of bolts of Wet Willie rather than running out to the anchors from the overhang.
content.protection: 7 or 8 draws should suffice.  Bring some runners for slinging the horns.
content.location: Just left of Little Wing.

content.description: Starts on a slab for 3 bolts, then has a small ledge. Continue up a lieback crack for several bolts to the anchors just below the top.
content.location: Located 60' up the hill from Day at the Races.  Starts on a small slab that has a small pine at the top of the slab before the crack starts.

content.description: Climb up a crack system and belay under a large, overhanging nose.  This would be a great first trad lead for an aspiring leader.  This is a soft 5.6.
content.protection:
standard rack, but mostly bigger stuff up to a BD #4.

 Anchor consists of cordalette and lockers. (5/12/14)

 No cordalette anchor anymore (02/08/2020). Scramble another 20-30ft to a tree and horn rappel
content.location: The Alley (South Face) up the hill from Bounty Hunter and Great Balls of Fire.

content.description: Just left of the jungle, work through some loose rock to a notch behind a flake and continue to belay anchors on Russian One Step.
content.location: North Face (Main Fin).  Just left of Welcome to the Jungle.

content.description: This route is a  long thin finger crack.
content.location: Just left of Lucy in the Sky

content.description: Not a very pleasing route. Only 25 feet long it is very short, and not very fun because of it.
content.location: starts 100' uphill from Dancing with the Devil.  Follow the trail up the rock to it.

content.description: Follows a set of small ledges until about halfway up the wall.  A fun route with plenty of resting areas on the small ledges.  Straightforward climb, but has a few nice moves towards the top.  Good views from the top.
content.location: To the left of the huge flake and Rumpleforeskin.

content.description: Located on the same face as Malice, it has a lot of the same types of moves, but even more difficult.  The pockets tend to be sloped and difficult to get good friction due to the sand nature of the stone.  Shares its anchor with Malice as well.
content.location: Just to the left of Malice, on the other side of the large tree.

content.description:
Start just right of Palm Tree.  Follow short diagonal crack.  Move left and belay at a suspicious, dead tree.  Note:  Back up the belay with some gear.  (Info taken from DCA 2005) 

  The crux of this climb is probably the transition into the diagonal crack halfway up the route.  Once the last bolt is clipped, however, you're home free.
content.protection: 5 bolts.  There was a "suspicious" tree to rap off, but it's real dead. There is now a rat's nest with a locking biner that Palm Tree and Bounty Hunter end at. Rap off and/or back-up with own gear.
content.location: Just right of Palm Tree.  The Alley (South Face)

content.description: Devil's Racetrack is a formation of two rock 'fins' that stick out of the side of the mountains along side of I-75 just North of the 134 exit in Caryville.  They are all very solid rock, nothing is very brittle, but the thing you have to look for is vegetation.  Moss is really bad on several spots. Other than that the rock is spectacular.  Great views on top of great climbs.  The bolts are all really well placed, and anchors are very solid.  The approach trail is a tad steep in some spots, so be careful if its wet out.  The routes range from 5.3 to 5.9 on trad and 5.8 to 5.11 on sport.  So there is stuff for everyone.
